definition: storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
howling wind and torrential rain (idiom)/(fig.) difficult, dangerous situation

sentences.english: No problem is permanent storms always give way to the sun.
sentences.chinese: 风暴总会给阳光让路，寒冬总会转变为暖春。

sentences.english: The sailors took in sail when they saw the storm approach.
sentences.chinese: 水手们看见风暴快来了，就动手收帆。

sentences.english: In the raging storm the ship's masts were carried away.
sentences.chinese: 在狂风暴雨中，船桅被刮走了。

sentences.english: The storm will enter the baroclinic zone.
Two powerful storms are threatening the coastal United States.
sentences.chinese: 两场强风暴正在威胁美国海岸地区。

sentences.english: The storm is under the influence of STR.
sentences.chinese: 风暴正受副热带高压脊的影响。

sentences.english: At present, the age of storm deposits reported in China may be traced back to late proterozoic.
sentences.chinese: 目前我国已报导的风暴沉积时代可追溯到晚元古代。

sentences.english: So we have this site called Idea Storm, which is really fascinating.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们建立了思想风暴的网站，它很有吸引力。

sentences.english: Soul of a force on the storm, swept the continent magic peak.
sentences.chinese: 一切关于魂力的风暴，席卷大陆的幻术巅峰。

sentences.english: It is the perfect storm for the dollar, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 对美元来说这无异于一场完美风暴，”他说。

sentences.english: And what should countries do to prepare for more intense droughts and storms?
sentences.chinese: 国家应该怎样为应对更严峻的干旱和风暴做好准备？

sentences.english: The summer storm laid the crops.
sentences.chinese: 夏日的风暴刮倒了庄稼。

sentences.english: After the large and treacherous wind storm that hit New England a few weeks ago, I lost power.
sentences.chinese: 我家在险恶的强风暴袭击新英格兰后几周停电。

sentences.english: Voyager was heading for an ocean storm.
sentences.chinese: “航行者”号正驶向一个大洋风暴。

sentences.english: We have simply used nature's ways to open up the magnetosphere without benefit of storm.
sentences.chinese: 我们只不过运用自然的方式张开磁层，而非利用风暴。

sentences.english: The company at the center of the storm is Synutra.
sentences.chinese: 身处事件风暴中心的公司是圣元国际集团。

definition: to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
